title: As Houthis vow to fight on, U.S. prepares for sustained campaign
description: U.S. officials say they don’t expect operations in Yemen to last years, but they acknowledge it’s unclear when the Houthis’ military capability will be eroded.

title: How Houthi attacks on ships in the Red Sea threaten Israel’s economy
description: In just a few months, Yemen’s Houthis have taken an outsize bite out of global shipping — and have begun to threaten economically their stated target, Israel.

title: American teen killed in West Bank, leaving mosque ‘devastated’ back home
description: Tawfic Hafeth Abdel Jabbar, a 17-year-old who grew up in the New Orleans area, was killed Friday in the West Bank, according to his relative.

title: A Belgian port seized tons of cocaine. Criminals tried to take it back.
description: Belgian customs officers seized three times as much cocaine in the port of Antwerp last year as U.S. customs and border officials seized in all of the United States.

title: ‘Succession’ creator Jesse Armstrong says there’ll be no spinoffs
description: Armstrong also told the BBC that while “Succession” characters did “reprehensible” things, he didn’t “think of them as irredeemable.”

title: A kitchen table amputation without anesthetic in Gaza is one of many
description: The gruesome procedure highlights the daily horrors facing Gazans amid the collapse in their health care system.

title: Breaking protection pledge, Russian regions reinstate animal kill shelters
description: The dog-loving Russian leader changed the constitution to keep himself in power ans added an animal protection provision. But now regions have new authority to kill strays.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: U.S. destroys three Houthi anti-ship missiles
description: The U.S. said it struck missiles that were aimed at Red Sea targets. The Houthis said they would focus on blockading Israel and retaliating for U.S.-led airstrikes.

title: Zvi Zamir, Israeli spy chief amid war and tragedy, dies at 98
description: Mr. Zamir directed Mossad operations against Palestinian militants after 11 Israeli Olympic team members were killed at the 1972 Games in Munich.
